description: OR operator is not supported in the "General" tab of the message pane in default mode as in the "Search" tab.    *+VCS versions used in testing : (VCS P-2020.03-Alpha_Full64)+*   VCS TD build : "/remote/vtgimages/SAFE/linux64_TD/release-structure/vcs-mx/bin/vcs"         +*VERDI versions used in testing : (Verdi_P-2020.03-Alpha)*+   Verdi TD build : "/remote/vtgimages/SAFE/linux64_TD.VERDI/release-structure/verdi/bin/verdi"         *[Testcase]*   Path : $VERDI_HOME/demo/verilog/rtl         *[How to Reproduce]*    1. Set the following environment variables.                 a. %setenv VCS_HOME /remote/vtgimages/SAFE/linux64_TD/release-structure/vcs-mx/bin/vcs                 b. %setenv VERDI_HOME /remote/vtgimages/SAFE/linux64_TD.VERDI/release-structure/verdi/bin/Verdi                 c. %setenv NOVAS_HOME /remote/vtgimages/SAFE/linux64_TD.VERDI/release-structure/verdi/bin/Verdi                 d. %setenv VERDI_UNIFIED_FIND 1    2. cp -rL $VERDI_HOME/demo/verilog/rtl/* .   3. vcs -f run.f -kdb -lca -debug_access+all   4. simv -verdi -verdi_opts -ultra -lca &   5. Click File ---> Compile Design and then double click on "run.f" and then click "Compile" and then "Close"   6. Click on the "General" tab of the "Message Pane"   7. Turn off "Match Case" in the unified find widget and make sure that it is in the default match mode (Wildcard/RegEx/Find Whole Words Only features turned off)   8. Click on the general tab of the message pane and make sure that it is the current active window. Then press Ctrl+F to activate the cursor in the text field of the U/F widget.   9. Type the text inside the double quotes and hit enter. Observe the search results. " alu || chil "   10. Click on the source pane and press "/" to get the Find String dialog box.   11. Type "mux*" in the text box corresponding to "Find Pattern" and click "Find All" (turn off the match case option in the dialog box)   12. Repeat the same for "first*" (turn off the match case option in the dialog box)   13. Click on the search tab of the message pane and press "Ctrl+F"   14. Type "mux1 || data" and hit enter. Observe the search results.         *[Issues]*   The search results returned only show matches to the first search string [step 09]   However  "search" tab delivers the correct search results when the same operator is used [step 14]    General tab in message pane does not respond to the OR operator correctly.

summary: CLONE - Declaration Pane has issues in responding to arrow keys
description: Declaration pane would only respond to up/down arrow keys when the mouse is hovered over the same pane. If the user does not click on the pane body  the arrow keys take effect on the previous active window.  VCS versions used in testing : --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- VCS TD build   :  "/remote/vtgimages/SAFE/linux64_TD/release-structure/vcs-mx/bin/vcs"   VERDI versions used in testing : (Verdi_P-2019.06-Beta0) --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Verdi TD build  :  "/remote/vtgimages/SAFE/linux64_TD.VERDI/release-structure/verdi/bin/verdi"  [Testcase] Path :  $VERDI_HOME/demo/verilog/rtl  [How to Reproduce]  SCENARIO 1 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  1. Click on the name tab "declaration"  7. Observe the colour of the banner of the declaration pane (it should be dark blue)  8. If the banner is not dark blue  click on the banner of the declaration pane.  9. You should see a light yellow highlight on one of the components in the declaration pane (Refer <STAR_ID.PNG>)  10. Hover the mouse pointer over a different window (any window other than the declaration pane)  11. Press "up" arrow key two/three times. Observe the highlight.  12. Now  hover the mouse pointer over the declaration pane.  13. Repeat step 11. Observe the highlight color.  SCENARIO 2 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  1. Set the following environment variables.           a. %setenv /remote/vtgimages/SAFE/linux64_TD/release-structure/vcs-mx/bin/vcs           b. %setenv /remote/vtgimages/SAFE/linux64_TD.VERDI/release-structure/verdi/bin/verdi           c. %setenv VERDI_ENABLE_ACTIVE_WIN 1   2. cp -rL $VERDI_HOME/demo/verilog/rtl/* .  3. rm -rf inter* novas* verdiLog csrc simv* ucli.key verdiLog  4. vcs -f run.f -lca -kdb -debug_access+all  5. simv -verdi &  6. Click on the name tab "declaration"  7. Observe the colour of the banner of the declaration pane (it should be dark blue)  8. If the banner is not dark blue  click on the body of the declaration pane.  9. You should see a light yellow highlight on one of the components in the declaration pane (Refer <STAR_ID.PNG>)  10. Hover the mouse pointer over a different window (any window other than the declaration pane)  11. Press "up" arrow key two/three times. Observe the highlight.  12. Now  hover the mouse pointer over the declaration pane.  13. Repeat step 11. Observe the highlight color.  SCENARIO 3 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  1. Set the following environment variables.              a. %setenv /remote/vtgimages/SAFE/linux64_TD/release-structure/vcs-mx/bin/vcs              b. %setenv /remote/vtgimages/SAFE/linux64_TD.VERDI/release-structure/verdi/bin/verdi              c. %setenv VERDI_ENABLE_ACTIVE_WIN 1   2. cp -rL $VERDI_HOME/demo/verilog/rtl/* .  3. rm -rf inter* novas* verdiLog csrc simv* ucli.key verdiLog  4. vcs -f run.f -lca -kdb -debug_access+all  5. simv -verdi &  6. Open the signal list.  7. Click on the name tab "Declaration"  8. Click on one of the signals on the signal list.  9. Click on the banner of the declaration pane.  10. Hit the up/down arrow keys while observing the signal list.   [Issues] SCENARIO 1 and 2 ---->  If the user does not  hover the mouse pointer over the declaration pane even when it is active  the arrow keys do not respond.  SCENARIO 3 ---> Arrow keys take effect on the signal list. Not the declaration pane.  [Note] Note that step 08 is the only difference between the first two scenarios.
